html: The God who commenced the work of his creation—of the heavens and the earth, the nations of the world, and his people Israel—also sees it through to the finish: “I was at the first and I am at the last” ( Isaiah 44:6); “I am he who was at the first, and I am he who is at the last” ( Isaiah 48:12). The “last” or end consists of Jehovah’s appointing everlasting “dynasties” to those holy and valiant ones who ascend to the category of seraphs: “‘As the new heavens and the new earth which I make shall endure before me,’ says Jehovah, ‘so shall your offspring and name endure’” ( Isaiah 66:22; cf. 59:21; 61:9).
